text: What are folks' thoughts on [[Sphinx of Magosi]] in [[Mairsil]]? I like that for 3 mana you can draw a card and put +1 counters on Mairsil. If you have [[Training Grounds]] out, you do this for U.

attachments.fallback: Sphinx of Magosi {3}{U}{U}{U} // Creature — Sphinx // Flying // {2}{U}: Draw a card, then put a +1/+1 counter on Sphinx of Magosi. // 6/6
attachments.text:
Creature — Sphinx
Flying
{2}{U}: Draw a card, then put a +1/+1 counter on Sphinx of Magosi.
_"A riddle is nothing more than a trap for small minds, baited with the promise of understanding."_
*6/6*
attachments.title: Sphinx of Magosi {3}{U}{U}{U}

text: I think Sphinx isn't bad at all in the 99. Out of all the options he seems the most viable that isn't a wizard.
For drawing cards at least.
Seems pretty good
Mairsil isn't tribal...
I'm a fan of the sphinx, but I'm less so of cards that only work for 1 specific purpose, and outside of exiling it with Mairsil it'll be a pita to hard cast the sphinx in a three color deck
Almost all of the high-cmc cards in Mairsil are never meant to be cast.
He is if you build him that way. Some people work tribal subthemes into just about any general as a backup plan.
I don't think it's a bad choice though
Not saying it's advisable, but it's a thing.
I've been trying out Nate's list in Forge and found card draw a big issue, so this is a fairly cheap activated ability to draw a card with even more upside.

They're never meant to be cast, but that seems like a risky way to build a deck, like those Jeleva builds running a all 8-drop spells assuming you can just cast and swing with Jeleva all day, or those Kalia decks who don't realize Darksteel Mutation exists so they run nothing but big-ass boros angels
That said Mairsil just needs to come into play to get the ability
Which is way easier that play and swing with Jeleva or Kaalia
Sure, but that's also why you have so many other cards that allow you to protect Mairsil or plenty of sack outlets. A bug is still a creature.
Right - and unlike Jeleva he gets all those exiled card abilities between casts.
I don't doubt it'll work great if you have perfect draws of protection and abilities every turn :slightly_smiling_face:
I just keep hearing the same thing about Mairisl where any criticism is countered with "but I can prevent that becuase it's always magical christmasland!"

It's a puzzle deck with tons of cheap ways to give Mairsil interaction or protection, etc. The real problem is a deck so focused on a single creature. Unlike Gonti, you do care that Mairsil stays in play.
I'm not sure I like the play style as much as I thought, but I think Mairsil is very open-ended...
Maybe he'll be that great. I wasn't wow'ed by Breya prior to seeing her in games either
He's certainly got a shit-tonne of ways you can take him
I really like commanders like that...I hate linear builds
Also, he can grow/change as new cards are introduced.
I do think he's going to lend himself to people trying to do to much and thus accomplishing nothing
At least initially
Yup...it is a VERY complicated deck to pilot.
It is also too easy to make a mana-hungry build
I'm even considering a 'big mana' build that's essentially mono-black with enough splash to keep casting Mairsil.
Wonder if we'll see a rise of Cursed Totem or Damping Matrix
You are if you're <@U3QMCLQQG>
I played Kess last night. I built her too slow, but she was fun, and I won off of Torment of Hailfire.
But I thought giving your opponents choices was bad?
And, yeah, both of those cards are devastating for Mairsil, and a decent number of other commanders and creatures.
Not if they have to repeat the process 30 times.
Also, FYI, the Increasing cycle from Innistrad is really good with Kess.
The Beacons seem good with Kess
They only specify that you cast them from the graveyard, not that you flash them back. [[Increasing Vengeance]] is especially good.

attachments.fallback: Increasing Vengeance {R}{R} // Instant // Copy target instant or sorcery spell you control. If Increasing Vengeance was cast from a graveyard, copy that spell twice instead. You may choose new targets for the copies. // Flashback {3}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
attachments.text:
Instant
Copy target instant or sorcery spell you control. If Increasing Vengeance was cast from a graveyard, copy that spell twice instead. You may choose new targets for the copies.
Flashback {3}{R}{R} _(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_
attachments.title: Increasing Vengeance {R}{R}

text: The beacons are pretty good, I guess. Maybe for a more reanimator-themed version? Ill-Gotten Gains is pretty good, even though I never cast it.

I played against a proxy kess list last night. He was just running Kess valuetown with spell copies, etc. so there was a lot of "cast Gamble, copy it with Pyromancer's Goggles, then recast Gamble" going on
[[Delirium Skeins]] is absolutely devastating.

attachments.fallback: Delirium Skeins {2}{B} // Sorcery // Each player discards three cards.
attachments.text:
Sorcery
Each player discards three cards.
_There came a rush, a sudden fire in the mind. Then the two saw only the sooty fog of madness, heard only the crackling of their last thoughts burning away._
attachments.title: Delirium Skeins {2}{B}

text: Also the Xenith's
Yeah, when you're running lots of windfall/wheel effects. Buyback is good also
Those are this week's decks. I can get you a list if you want.
Sure, would be sweet
Okay, when I boot up the PC I'll export it for you.
What's your platform of choice?
Just output in an MTGO format - just a text file.
Deckstats or tappedout?
Oh, okay
Can do.

Do you have a tappedout decklist for Mairsil yet Henry? I'd like to take a look at it if you don't mind. I am really liking him... so many different ways to go, and cutting cards has never been more difficult.
I created a "fun" list for my article this week (releasing Thursday), but may end up building something a little more competitive for my playgroup.

And... just read Bryce's article on Mairsil (great read by the way)... wow... it's amazing how many radically different strategies all fall under the umbrella of Mairsil. Other than a few mana rocks, our two decklists share maybe 7 of the same cards.
I'm loving Mairsil. My favorite from this set, I think
Agreed. So many cool things to do.

>>>
Finished the paper build of the average Sidisi, Brood Tyrant @edhrec deck and I like it, but time to start swapping EWilds 4 a proper fetch.
wat
people build the average edhrec decks in paper?
I hope only for some kind of thought exercise
Have to start the deckbuilding process somewhere.
Yeah I know of a couple younger edh players that begin their builds like this. Seems like a gamble but not a bad idea to start with a pile of the highest usage cards right?
It can be a fine starting point as it begs the questions "how do I make this better?"
